segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge of the sink, and the woman doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while standing in a puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being sneaky, but she’s too distracted to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this is a metaphor for something, but I’m not sure what.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and the girl is just encouraging him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a ticking time bomb.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m almost laughing at how ridiculous it all is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to cause so much damage if it keeps going like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone does something before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s obliviousness is both funny and frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR
